keyword: how many calories in a jalapeno
title: How Many Calories in a Jalapeño?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a jalapeno, plus carbs, protein, fat, and other nutrients on a per-pepper basis with quick tweaks and FAQs.
h1: How Many Calories in a Jalapeño?
assumptions: Fresh, raw jalapeño pepper, average size (~14 g), green and unripe.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by size, ripeness, variety, and preparation method. Values are approximate; check labels for processed versions.

quick_answer.text: A single jalapeño pepper contains about 4 calories and is low in carbs and fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Pickled in brine (adds sodium and slight calories)

faqs.q: How many calories in a jalapeno pepper?
faqs.a: About 4 kcal for one average-sized raw jalapeño.
Yes, one jalapeño has ~0.9 g carbs, including 0.4 g fiber.

faqs.q: Does cooking change calories in a jalapeno?
faqs.a: Minimal change if no oil is added; roasting might add 5 kcal with light oil.

faqs.q: How much protein in a jalapeno?
faqs.a: Very little, about 0.2 g per pepper.
Fresh ones have ~1 mg; pickled versions can have 200+ mg.
